sn22.96:1.2: Seated to one side, that mendicant said to the Buddha:
sn22.96:1.3: “Sir, is there any form at all that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever?
sn22.96:1.7: consciousness at all that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever?”
sn22.96:1.8: “Mendicant, there is no form at all that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever.
sn22.96:1.12: consciousness at all that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever.”
sn22.96:2.1: Then the Buddha, picking up a lump of cow dung, said to the mendicants:
sn22.96:2.2: “There’s not even this much of any incarnation that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever.
sn22.96:2.3: If there were, this living of the spiritual life for the complete ending of suffering would not be found.
sn22.96:2.4: But since there isn’t, this living of the spiritual life for the complete ending of suffering is found.
sn22.96:3.1: Once upon a time I was an anointed aristocratic king.
sn22.96:3.2: I had 84,000 cities, with the capital Kusāvatī the foremost.
sn22.96:3.3: I had 84,000 palaces, with the Palace of Principle the foremost.
sn22.96:3.4: I had 84,000 chambers, with the Chamber of the Grand Tower the foremost.
sn22.96:3.5: I had 84,000 couches made of ivory or heartwood or gold or silver, spread with woolen covers—shag-piled or embroidered with flowers—and spread with a fine deer hide, with a canopy above and red pillows at both ends.
sn22.96:3.6: I had 84,000 bull elephants with gold adornments and banners, covered with snow gold netting, with the royal bull elephant named Sabbath the foremost.
sn22.96:3.7: I had 84,000 horses with gold adornments and banners, covered with snow gold netting, with the royal steed named Thundercloud the foremost.
sn22.96:3.8: I had 84,000 chariots with gold adornments and banners, covered with snow gold netting, with the chariot named Triumph the foremost.
sn22.96:3.9: I had 84,000 jewels, with the jewel-treasure the foremost.
sn22.96:3.10: I had 84,000 women, with Queen Subhaddā the foremost.
sn22.96:3.11: I had 84,000 aristocrat vassals, with the commander-treasure the foremost.
sn22.96:3.12: I had 84,000 milk cows with muslin halter and bronze pails.
sn22.96:3.13: I had 8,400,000,000 delicate cloths of linen, cotton, silk, and wool.
sn22.96:3.14: I had 84,000 servings of food, which were presented to me as offerings in the morning and evening.
sn22.96:4.1: Of those 84,000 cities, I only stayed in one, the capital Kusāvatī.
sn22.96:4.2: Of those 84,000 palaces, I only dwelt in one, the Palace of Principle.
sn22.96:4.3: Of those 84,000 chambers, I only dwelt in one, the  Chamber of the Grand Tower.
sn22.96:4.4: Of those 84,000 couches, I only used one, made of ivory or heartwood or gold or silver.
sn22.96:4.5: Of those 84,000 bull elephants, I only rode one, the royal bull elephant named Sabbath.
sn22.96:4.6: Of those 84,000 horses, I only rode one, the royal horse named Thundercloud.
sn22.96:4.7: Of those 84,000 chariots, I only rode one, the chariot named Triumph.
sn22.96:4.8: Of those 84,000 women, I was only served by one, an aristocrat maiden or a coquette.
sn22.96:4.9: Of those 8,400,000,000 cloths, I only wore one pair, made of delicate linen, cotton, silk, and wool.
sn22.96:4.10: Of those 84,000 servings of food, I only had one, eating at most a cup of rice with suitable sauce.
sn22.96:4.11: And so all those conditioned phenomena have passed, ceased, and perished.
sn22.96:4.15: This is quite enough for you to become disillusioned, dispassionate, and freed regarding all conditions.”
